alert.note: Alert for Bath; Fleming; Rowan (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 12 at 6:15PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Bath, southeastern Fleming and central Rowan Counties through 700 PM EDT... At 614 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Reynoldsville, or near Owingsville, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Marshall, Peasticks, Pebble and Polksville around 620 PM EDT. Wyoming, Oakley and Moore`s Ferry around 625 PM EDT. Grange City, Hillsboro and Ramey around 630 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Ringos Mills, Sharkey, Poplar Plains, Plummers Landing, Hilda, Goddard, Muses Mills, Cranston, Hays Crossing, Munson, Waltz and Triplett. THIS INCLUDES Interstate 64 in eastern Kentucky between mile markers 117 and 148. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
